content:
• Thursday, June 28, 2018
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm +1.6% after enrolling first patient in glioblastoma study

    • Ziopharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) is up 1.6% after hours, adding to the day's gains, after noting it enrolled its first patient in a phase 1 clinical trial for combination therapy of controlled IL-12 and Opdivo.
    • The study will evaluate Ad-RTS-hIL-12 plus veledimex in combination with Opdivo (nivolumab) in adult patients with recurrent glioblastoma ((rGBM)).
    • “By controlling interleukin 12, Ad-RTS-hIL-12 plus veledimex already has shown it can recruit killer T cells into the tumor and increase expression of checkpoints in this microenvironment," says Chief Medical Officer Francois Lebel.
    • Ziopharm expects to enroll up to 18 patients in the study, in multiple leading brain cancer centers in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 PM | 20 Comments
  • VRTX

    Vertex +7.1% as rival Galapagos stumbles with AbbVie

    • Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) is up 7.1% after hours following the release of data from rival Galapagos (NASDAQ:GLPG) that led AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV) to pull out of plans to proceed on triple combination therapy for cystic fibrosis.
    • ABBV is down 1.2% after hours; GLPG is down 12.8%.
    • Vertex and PTI are working to hustle toward triple combination therapies for the disease.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:30 PM | 11 Comments
  • KBH

    KB Home +5% after Q2 earnings top estimates amid strong housing market

    • KB Home (NYSE:KBH) +5.1% after-hours following a strong Q2 earnings beat and a $10% Y/Y rise in revenue to $1.1B, supported by higher home prices and tighter supply.
    • KBH also outperformed analyst expectations for 2,588 delivery units during the quarter with a 5% Y/Y gain to 2,717, its average selling price climbed 4% to $401.800, and overall operating income jumped 50% to $74M.
    • Q2 housing gross profit margin gained 170 bps to 17.1% vs. 16.8%-17.2% guidance, and net orders rose 3% to 3,532; ending backlog value grew 3% to $2.24B with the number of homes in backlog increasing 3% to 5,787, the company's highest Q2 backlog value in 11 years.
    • “In the quarter, we produced double-digit revenue growth, expanded our operating margin and significantly improved our profitability, reflecting solid execution on our core business strategy," KBH says. "Moreover, we measurably increased our absorptions per community by 15%."
     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike +9% as North America sales return to growth, beating estimates

    • Nike (NYSE:NKE) +9.2% after-hours as it posts stronger than expected FQ4 earnings and revenues and announces a new $15B buyback program.
    • “Our new innovation is winning with consumers, driving significant momentum in our international geographies and a return to growth in North America,” CEO Mark Parker says, as North America sales jumped 2.76%, easily beating analyst consensus for a 0.98% increase.
    • Meanwhile, NKE says its quarterly sales excluding currency changes climbed 10% in Europe, the Middle East and Africa; 25% in Greater China; and 13% in Asia Pacific and Latin America; overall footwear sales rose 8% and apparel sales surged 15% while equipment sales fell 3%.
    • Gross margin rose to 44.7% from 44.1% in the prior-year quarter, which NKE says was due primarily to higher average selling prices and its push to sell directly to shoppers.
    • NKE is more upbeat about FY 2019, now seeing revenues rising by a high-single-digit percentage rate, up from a mid-to-high range.
    • Among related tickers, FL +3.3%, UA +2.1% after-hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:34 PM | 23 Comments
  • GLPG

    Galapagos -13% after AbbVie pulls out of cystic fibrosis development plans

    • Galapagos (NASDAQ:GLPG) -13.3% after-hours following news that AbbVie (NYSE:ABBV) decided not to proceed with a study of a combination therapy for cystic fibrosis, and GLPG says it is reviewing the future of its collaboration with ABBV.
    • Galapagos expects the first interim data in Q3 from its FALCON clinical trial with an investigational triple combination therapy comprising potentiator GLPG2451, C1 corrector GLPG2222 and C2 corrector GLPG2737, but says ABBV would pull out of the previously contemplated second triple combination therapy.
    • Galapagos also saiys a study of GLPG2737, one of the elements of the potential combination therapy, achieved its primary endpoint.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 15 Comments
  • GEMP

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/28/2018)

    • Top Gainers: GEMP +58%. VRTX +7%. NKE +6%. HYGS +6%. BLDP +5%.
    • Top Losers: SRV -8%. OTCQB:AXIM -5%. KOPN -3%. ATUS -3%. NVT -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:29 PM | 7 Comments
  • SNX

    Synnex acquires Convergys for $2.43B

    • Synnex (NYSE:SNX) confirms earlier reports that it has acquired Convergys (NYSE:CVG) for $2.43B.
    • The deal is for $26.50/share including $13.25/share in cash and 0.1193 Synnex common shares for each Convergys common stock share. 
    • Cost synergies expected of $50M in the first year, achieving a minimum of $150M by the third year. 
    • Synnex expects non-GAAP EPS accretion of mid-single digits in the first year, up to double-digits by the second year. 
    • Synnex shares are down 2.9% aftermarket to $103.70.
    • Convergys shares are down 0.3% to $25.30.  
    • Previously: Convergys up 6% on report of sale (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • CELG

    Acceleron +3% on positive Phase III Luspatercept data

    • Celgene (NASDAQ:CELG) and Acceleron (NASDAQ:XLRN) announce that Luspatercept achieved primary and key secondary endpoints in Phase III MEDALIST study for low-to-intermediate-risk myelodysplastic syndromes.
    • Primary endpoint was red blood cell transfusion independence of at least 8 consecutive weeks during the first 24 weeks compared to placebo. 
    • Secondary endpoints: Improvement in RBC transfusion independence of at least 12 consecutive weeks during the first 24 was the key endpoint. Modified hematologic improvement-erythroid was a meaningful secondary endpoint. 
    • Data from the trial will be submitted to a “future medical meeting in 2018.”
    • The companies plan to submit regulatory applications in the US and Europe in 1H19.   
    • Celgene shares are up 0.7% aftermarket to $77.17. 
    • Acceleron Pharma shares are up 3% to $34.99.   
     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM | 11 Comments
  • A

    Agilent Tech acquires ProZyme

    • Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A) acquires glycan analysis company ProZyme for undisclosed terms.
    • The privately-held ProZyme provides glycan analysis reagents, kits, and standards.  
    • Agilent shares are down 0.2% aftermarket to $61.15.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • GEMP

    Gemphire Therapeutics +58% after study meets primary endpoint

    • Gemphire Therapeutics (NASDAQ:GEMP) +58.2% after-hours on news its Gemcabene drug candidate met its primary endpoint in an INDIGO-1 study of severe hypertriglyceridemia patients.
    • GEMP says median triglycerides significantly decreased by 47% in gemcabene (600 mg) treated patients vs. 27% for placebo-treated patients in the study.
    • Gemcabene is a first-in-class oral therapy that may be suitable for ~3.5M patients in the U.S. who need to lower their levels of LDL-C or triglycerides to reduce their risk of developing acute pancreatitis.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 4 Comments
  • RMBS

    Rambus -1.1% on CEO termination

    • Rambus (NASDAQ:RMBS) announces the departure of CEO Ron Black effective immediately.
    • The company says Black’s termination was unrelated to financial and business performance but instead because his conduct “fell short of the Company’s standards.” 
    • Black also resigned from the board.
    • Luc Seraphin, SVP & GM of the Memory and Interfaces Division, will serve as interim CEO. 
    • Rambus shares are down 1.1% aftermarket to $12.85.  
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • NKE

    Nike beats by $0.05, beats on revenue

    • Nike (NYSE:NKE): Q4 EPS of $0.69 beats by $0.05.
    • Revenue of $9.8B (+12.9% Y/Y) beats by $390M.
    • Shares +3.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 24 Comments
  • TRVN

    Trevena completes Phase 1 study of migraine treatment

    • Among the findings in the study of TRV250: Dose-related increases in plasma concentrations following subcutaneous administration of doses up to 30 mg, with rapid absorption in the first hour and duration of exposure appropriate for treating acute migraine.
    • Subcutaneous doses at and above 9 mg achieved plasma concentrations that were active in preclinical models of migraine.
    • Oral bioavailability similar to existing migraine medications, supporting continued development of TRV250 in oral and/or subcutaneous formulations.
    • No observed drug-associated EEG changes, consistent with preclinical studies in which TRV250 avoided the seizure liability associated with previous CNS-active delta receptor agonists.
    • No clinically significant changes in vital signs, laboratory values, or ECG parameters, and no severe or serious adverse events reported.
    • Source: Press Release
    • TRVN +8% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 5 Comments
  • IBM

    Nomura initiates IBM at 16% upside on cloud potential

    • Nomura Instinet initiates IBM (NYSE:IBM) with a Buy rating and a $160 price target, a 16% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Jeffrey Kvaal thinks IBM is headed for “sustained” revenue growth due to cloud and lead sales tech turnarounds.  
    • IBM shares are up 1.9% to $140.03. 
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 18 Comments
  • QURE

    uniQure +13%, Sorrento Therapeutics +5% as B. Riley DBR starts at Buy

    • UniQure (QURE +13.1%) shoots higher after B. Riley FBR initiates coverage with a Buy rating and a $50 price target, believing that AMT-061 has the potential to dominate the hemophilia B adeno-associated virus gene therapy space.
    • In particular, success in a dose confirmation guided to start by the end of Q2, with a readout expected by year-end 2018, potentially could be a key inflection point for QURE shares, the firm says.
    • QURE announced earlier today that it has enrolled its first patient in a Phase 3 HOPE-B pivotal study of AMT-061.
    • The firm also starts Sorrento Therapeutics (SRNE +5.1%) with a Buy rating and a $14.25 target, saying SRNE is leveraging its proprietary technological expertise, which includes one of the world's most robust fully human monoclonal antibody libraries, to develop novel chimeric antigen receptor T-cell treatments.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • SNX

    Convergys up 6% on report of sale

    • The rumored Synnex (SNX -0.7%) acquisition of Convergys (CVG +5.8%) is close, according to the WSJ, which is reporting a possible deal price of about $26.50 per share, or nearly $2.5B.
    • CVG's spike higher brings it to $25.63.
    • Previously: Convergys +4.3% on report of potential sale to Synnex (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRTO

    Criteo launches $23M AI lab in Paris

    • Criteo (NASDAQ:CRTO) is investing $23M in a new AI lab in Paris and plans to hire researchers over the next three years.
    • VP of Research Suju Rajan will lead the lab. 
    • The lab could help Criteo diversify its product portfolio beyond retargeting as browsers increasingly offer tracking protection and Europe’s new GDPR law requires mandatory pop-ups that let users opt-out of such ads. 
    • Criteo shares are down 2.3% to $32.47.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • DLTR

    Dollar Tree +2% as Credit Suisse revisits potential for Family Dollar deal

    • Dollar Tree (DLTR +2%) is down 21% YTD but Credit Suisse's Judah Frommer thinks investors should stick with the stock, reiterating an Outperform rating and raising his price target to $99 from $93, saying DLTR could sell the Family Dollar business.
    • DLTR has not said it wanted to sell the unit, but Frommer feels the "perceived ability to monetize Family Dollar should bolster its valuation," along with his belief that it will see a near-term improvement in operations.
    • Dollar General (DG +0.6%) unsuccessfully tried to bid for Family Dollar in 2014, but Frommer still likes the synergies and strategic rationale for DG to make another try for the business.
    • The "strategic alternatives available to Dollar Tree are becoming increasingly clear to investors," Frommer writes, "as is the peer-lagging multiple being placed on the Family Dollar business."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 7 Comments
  • FB

    Instagram Stories hits 400M daily users, double Snapchat

    • Instagram (FB +0.6%) Stories now have 400M daily users compared to Snapchat’s (SNAP +4.1%) 191M, according to new Instagram data and Snap’s Q1 report, respectively.
    • Instagram’s latest update to Stories lets users add background music.
    • The Soundtrack feature will roll out to iOS users in the US, UK, Australia, New Zealand, France, Germany, and Sweden with a global roll-out coming “in the future.”
    • Instagram will offer a library of “thousands of songs” for Soundtrack. 
    • Previously: Report: Snap preparing gaming platform for fall (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 27 Comments
  • VVPR

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 PM (06/28/2018)

    • Gainers: VVPR +46%. NIHD +22%. PRGS +17%. AWRE +15%. CAVM +10%.
    • Losers: ABIL -17%. LINK -11%. IZEA -10%. SMTX -9%. FTR -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 3 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox shareholder urges hearing out Comcast counter-offer

    • One big shareholder in Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX +2.1%, FOXA +2%) is urging Rupert Murdoch to give Comcast (CMCSA +1%) a chance.
    • With Fox seemingly barreling toward closing a $71.3B agreement to sell its media assets to Disney (DIS +0.9%), TCI Fund Management wants to hear another counter-offer, Reuters reports.
    • The hedge fund owns 7.4% of Fox shares and is "strongly motivated" to support whichever deal comes at the biggest price.
    • That means disagreeing with Murdoch's stance that Comcast's offers, which until this latest one have been superior in absolute value, would come with higher regulatory risk.
    • The Justice Dept. has already signed off on Disney's agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 12 Comments
  • NIHD

    NII Holdings +14% on report of Nextel Brazil sale plans

    • NII Holdings (NASDAQ:NIHD) has jumped 14.1% after a Reuters report that says the company's hired advisers to sell its Nextel operations in Brazil.
    • The company's hired Rothschild to help it unload a 70% stake.
    • Potential buyers include Telefonica Brasil (VIV +1.2%) and Access Industries, which holds another 30% stake (which might be included in a forced sale if Access doesn't buy it all).
    • Nextel Brazil has 3M subscribers but poor earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:39 PM | 2 Comments
  • VG

    Vonage at two-year high with William Blair bullish

    • Vonage Holdings (NYSE:VG) has risen to a two-year high, up 3.6%, after a note from William Blair looks toward upcoming multiple expansion.
    • There's a "couple of turns" of opportunity there and the company could "rerate to a revenue multiple sometime in 2019," says analyst Dmitry Netis. M&A should play a big part in the company's strategy, he says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Netis has an Outperform rating on shares, joining more than a half-dozen other analysts.
    • Shares have gained 20.9% YTD and are up 85% over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM | 4 Comments
  • EROS

    Eros Now partners with Sri Lankan provider

    • Eros International (EROS -1.8%) has partnered with a Sri Lankan connectivity provider to add its Eros Now streaming service.
    • The Bollywood-focused film producer has a deal with Dialog Axiata to bring Eros Now to the Dialog ViU app, which has about 1M users.
    • Users will subscribe for a monthly fee of 100 rupees (about $1.45).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM

  • Big day for Mexican peso ahead of elections

    • A victory for Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador’s Morena party and even frostier relations between Mexico and the U.S. are already priced in, says Wells Fargo's Erik Nelson.
    • But consider the possibility that Lopez Obrador fails to secure a congressional majority, says Nelson. The peso, he suggests could quickly strengthen to 19 per dollar, and eventually rise to 17.50.
    • A worst-case scenario - a victory by Lopez Obrador and majorities in both houses of congress - could send the peso down to 21 per greenback.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • The peso today is up more than 2%, helping the iShares MSCI Mexico Capped ETF (EWW +2.9%) to a big gain.
    • ETFs: EWW, MXF, MXE, DBMX, HEWW, MEXX, FLMX
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • GBR

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/28/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +35%. BRN +16%. RPM +9%. UUUU +8%. SBGL +7%.
    • Losers: PFIE -14%. GEVO -13%. PED -7%. GPRE -7%. WOR -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • WELL

    Welltower, Brookdale Senior Living on the move after restructuring relationship

    • Welltower (NYSE:WELL) rises 3.2% and Brookdale Senior Living gains 2.4% the day after they announced a plan that reduces Welltower's reliance on Brookdale. The announcement came after close of trading yesterday.
    • Welltower agreed to early termination of Brookdale's triple-net lease obligations on 37 communities.
    • Brookdale is also getting out of a joint venture with Welltower, which will take on a new partner--recently formed Pegasus Senior Living.
    • Previously: Welltower starts new RIDEA joint venture with Pegasus Senior Living (June 27)
    • Previously: Brookdale Senior in early lease termination pact with Welltower, to sell JV stake (June 27)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • OMN

    More on OMNOVA Solutions Q2 results

    • OMNOVA Solutions (OMN +1.3%) reported Q2 net sales decrease of 6.8% Y/Y to $206.3M due to decline in sales of Performance materials segment.
    • Specialty solutions results: Sales $128.8M (+6% Y/Y) driven by 2.4% Y/Y increase in volumes and favorable forex of 3.7%. Adj. Operating margin improved by 276 bps to 17% and Adj. EBITDA margin improved by 289 bps to 20.4%
    • Performance materials results: Sales $77.5M (-22.34% Y/Y) volumes were down 10.9%, due to declining sales into the commodity paper market. Adj. Operating margin recovered by 799 bps to 0.8% and Adj. EBITDA margin declined by 247 bps to 4.6%.
    • Q2 Overall margins: Gross improved by 97 bps to 25% and Adj. EBITDA improved by 146 bps to 11.6%.
    • SG&A expenses decreased 8.9% Y/Y to $27.4M.
    • Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA improved to 3.0x from 3.6x.
    • Company announced the closure of its Green Bay, Wisconsin high volume styrene butadiene production facility and expects $7-8M in annualized savings.
    • Previously: Omnova Solutions beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • TWTR

    Twitter shuffles structure, centralizes engineering

    • Twitter (TWTR +1.6%) is shuffling leadership to a "more straightforward" management structure, according to memos just posted by CEO Jack Dorsey.
    • "Through the lens of increasing our durability, agility, invention and entrepreneurial drive, and simplifying the way we work, I've decided to make our organization more straightforward," Dorsey writes. "We are moving back to a functional organization."
    • "All of engineering will move to Mike Montano. Bluebird Product including Curation will move to Kayvon [Bekypour]. Revenue Product including the DES and MoPub product and business teams will continue to be led by Bruce [Falck]. User Services will move to Matt [Derella], broadening his customer focus."
    • The company's been operating under a general manager structure for a while, he notes, but it's "not a true GM structure in the full sense of being full-stack."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 4 Comments
  • CVM

    Cel-Sci -4.9% on $5M registered direct offering

    • Cel-Sci (NYSEMKT:CVM) announces a $5M registered direct offering with institutional investors.
    • In connection, Cel-Sci will issue about 3.9M registered shares of common stock at a $1.30/share purchase price.
    • Cel-Sci shares are down 4.9% to $1.57.
       
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM | 4 Comments
  • SJR

    Shaw Communications down 3.7% post Q3 results

    • Shaw Communications (SJR -3.7%) reports Q3 revenue growth of 6.9% Y/Y to C$1.3B.
    • Subscribers: Wireline of 5.74M (-1.2% Y/Y); Wireless of 1.32M (+14.8% Y/Y) & Total of 7.05M (+1.3% Y/Y).
    • Continued momentum in Wireless including strong customer demand for Big Gig data plans resulted in 27% Y/Y increase in service revenue and over 54,000 postpaid Wireless subscriber.
    • Operating margin increased marginally 10 bps to 42.1%; for Wireline increased 150 bps to 45.6% & for Wireless declined 110 bps to 26.2%.
    • Net debt leverage ratio of 2.0x & Free cash flow of C$191M (+44.7% Y/Y).
    • Capex of C$293M, a decline of C$7M in Wireline capital spending, primarily due to lower success-based capital, was offset by increased spending in Wireless of C$10M as the Company continues to invest in its network, including spectrum deployment.
    • When combined with existing corporate and dealer store network, Freedom Mobile expects to have ~600 retail locations operational in early 2019.
    • The Company is currently focused on building out its 700 MHz spectrum, which will continue throughout fiscal 2019.
    • 2018 Outlook: Consolidated operating income of ~C$2.1B; capital investments of ~C$1.38B; and free cash flow of ~C$375M.
    • Previously: Shaw Communications reports Q3 results (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • CLDC

    Financials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/28/2018)

    • Gainers: CLDC +11%. BFR +8%. CIFS +7%. RILY +7%. TRMT +6%.
    • Losers: LYL -8%. HGSH -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • GBR

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/28/2018)

    • Gainers: GBR +83%. PRGS +17%. PED +15%. BRN +14%. VVPR +12%. APOG +12%. USEG +11%. CLDC +11%. MSG +10%. STAF +10%.
    • Losers: ASNS -75%. DFBG-OLD -32%. KERX -24%. CADC -23%. AKBA -22%. GMS -22%. ABIL -21%. PIR -21%. HEI.A -20%. XELB -20%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • WBA

    BAML cuts Walgreens to Underperform; shares down 10% on session

    • An earnings beat, guidance boost, $10B buyback plan, and increase in dividend aren't coming close to outweighing Amazon's entry into drug distribution. Walgreens (NASDAQ:WBA) is lower by nearly 10%.
    • BAML's Michael Cherny expects pressure on the stock to stick, noting headwinds like pressure on core script growth, slower front-of-store growth, and now the Amazon threat.
    • He downgrades to Underperform from Neutral, with price target of $60 about matching the current price.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Pharmacy, drug distributor stocks fall on Amazon's PillPack acquisition (June 28)
    • Previously: Walgreens Boots Alliance boosts lower end of year adj. EPS guidance range (June 28)
    • Previously: Walgreens Boots Alliance authorizes $10B share repurchase program and increases quarterly dividend (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 49 Comments
  • TBIO

    Translate Bio opens about 9.7% below IPO price

    • Shares in Translate Bio (NASDAQ:TBIO) opened for trading at $11.50, below last night's IPO pricing of $13/share.
    • They're currently floating around $11.74, about a 9.7% decline.
    • The company priced at the midpoint of its range, but with the offering upsized from previous plans to 9.35M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • RAMP

    Acxiom +3.5% with $1.5B bids seen for data unit

    • Shares in Acxiom (NYSE:ACXM) are jumping, up 3.5%, after a WSJ report expecting bids of $1.5B-plus from ad giants for the company's data-marketing unit.
    • That's most of Acxiom, which has a market cap of $2.3B. Data marketing made up about three-quarters of total revenue in fiscal 2018.
    • Bids are expected from Interpublic Group (NYSE:IPG) and Dentsu (OTCPK:DNTUY) among others ahead of a deadline today, according to the report.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • SRNE

    Sorrento Therapeutics +2.2% as B. Riley starts at Buy

    • Sorrento Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRNE) is up 2.2% after a start at Buy by B. Riley, on the strength of a solid pipeline and recent strategic moves, including a partnership with Celularity.
    • The firm's Andrew D'Silva has a price target of $14.25, more than double current price of $6.95.
    • Sorrento shares are up 79% YTD and have gained 232% over the past 12 months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 14 Comments
  • LEA

    Trade tensions whack auto names

    • The major indexes are in the green, but the Russell 3000 Auto Part Index is now lower by more than 3% over the last two sessions. The president continues to threaten tariffs on German auto imports, and Osram has plunged more than 20% in Frankfurt after cutting forecasts, in part thanks to trade issues.
    • Bloomberg's Clelia Imperiali notes there are few possibilities for governments to cushion the impact, with company supply chains becoming ever more international.
    • Lear (LEA -4%), Visteon (VC -3.7%), American Axle (AXL -2.9%), Danaher (DAN -2.6%), Gentherm (THRM -0.9%), Tenneco (TEN -2.5%), Cooper-Standard (CPS -1.7%), BorgWarner (BWA -2.4%), Adient (ADNT -2.2%), Aptiv (APTV -1.6%)
    • Automakers: General Motors (GM -0.9%), Ford (F -2.1%), Fiat Chrysler (FCAU -1.8%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 23 Comments
  • GMS

    GMS down 20% on Q4 earnings miss

    • GMS (GMS -20.2%) reported Q4 net sales increase of 3.4% Y/Y to $635.8M, mainly driven by pricing improvement.
    • Net income decreased by 30.5% Y/Y to $9.9M and Adj. net income decreased by 9.3% Y/Y to $23.5M
    • Sales by product groups: Wallboards $279.98M (-0.77% Y/Y) with unit volumes of 878M sq ft (-3.1% Y/Y) and price improvement of 2.4%; Ceilings $95.64M (+9.32% Y/Y), steel framing $107.03M (+6.8% Y/Y) and other products $153.13M (+5.53% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Margins: Gross declined by 32 bps to 32.4% due to product mix; operating declined by 50 bps to 4.43% and Adj. EBITDA margin declined by 60 bps to 7.9%.
    • SG&A expenses were $161.65M (+5.7% Y/Y).
    • Titan update: GMS expects to record additional transaction related charges of $11-11.5M in 1Q19, including an additional $5.7M of mark-to-market currency adjustments.
    • Previously: GMS misses by $0.09, misses on revenue (June 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • SBGL

    Sibanye’s takeover of Lonmin approved by U.K. regulator

    • Sibanye-Stillwater (SBGL +5.1%) is higher after the U.K.’s Competition and Markets Authority clears its proposed acquisition of platinum producer Lonmin (OTC:LNMIF).
    • South African competition authorities still must give their approval, which also is still subject to shareholder approval as well as approval by courts in England and Wales.

  • CMG

    Chipotle’s strategic update seen as 'very limited' by analysts; shares -5%

    • Chipotle Mexican Grill (NYSE:CMG) -5.4% premarket after yesterday's strategic update left investors underwhelmed.
    • CEO Brian Niccol’s initiatives to drive up sales, including a focus on digitizing and modernizing restaurants, are viewed by analysts as the right moves but details on a timeline for expected results were called "very limited" by Karen Holthouse at Goldman Sachs.
    • CMG also failed to comment on the current quarter other than to say sales trends from Q1 have continued, and Holthouse thinks this may imply a potential shortfall vs. a consensus estimate of 2.5% comparable sales growth; Goldman rates the stock Neutral with a $450 price target.
    • While CMG’s call to outline its strategic priorities hit on all the expected high level topics, Morgan Stanley's John Glass says it lacked detail needed to provide a clearer path to ~$20 or more in EPS by 2020, which Glass thinks is needed to drive the stock higher; the firm rates CMG at Equal Weight with a $372 target.
    • With shares near a 52-week high, Wells Fargo's Jon Tower thinks investors were expecting more clarity on timing and financial impact of CMG's initiatives and without those details, shares likely will come under pressure; Wells rates CMG at Market Perform with a $405 price target.
    • Source: Bloomberg First Word
     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM | 5 Comments
